name: Comfort Inn & Suites San Francisco Airport North

reviews.text: Stayed here during a recent weekend trip to San Francisco and really enjoyed this hotel. It is in a great location right off highway 101. It was nice to have a quiet place to come back to after long days of sightseeing and tours. There are some good restaurants on the other side of the highway on Grand Avenue. The room was clean and the beds and pillows were very comfortable. Breakfast was good and there is a nice courtyard area to eat in. We would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Good Value!!! Nice Place!!!

reviews.text: The location was great, close to airport & close to highway to go downtown. The room was tiny! We had a 2 king room + a crib & there was barely any room to walk, however, the bathroom was huge! The parking could be a little better, the spaces are small & people double parked. The breakfast was awesome, lots of variety!
reviews.title: Good location, tiny room

reviews.text: I was in town April 10th for a Giants game (We won 10-0, by the way!) and I could not have been happier with this hotel. As soon as I checked in, I was given simple directions to the Caltrain station, along with a full schedule of trains' arrivals and departures. The next day, I asked if we could leave our car in their lot while we were out in the city, and Management was very friendly and helpful with accomadating us.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.text: The lobby was clean and breakfast was organized very well. As a Choice Hotel employee, I was very impressed with my entire stay. The room was outstanding and the beds were so comfortable! The Wi-Fi was a little iffy and slow, but other than that I had a fantastic stay. Thank you all so much!
reviews.title: Worst stay ever, House keepers are thefts.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Do not leave anything of value around with the staff in the building,more than likely it will come up missing. And of corse mangement can't track it down..funny thing is u know what house keepers clean what rooms..I'm really disappointed in the staff and management.
reviews.title: Good place but Slow wifi

reviews.text: We stayed here on our recent trip to San Francisco for 8 nights. I initially got a double king size bedroom. I was told that we couldn't have a crib in the room. Was changed to a king suite which had a sofa bed for my two oldest kids and had the extra two feet for the crib for the same price which made no sence because it was always at least 10 dollars cheaper.
reviews.title: Good price and location for a family on a budget

reviews.text: I was given five small pillows for the whole room. All of which where on the king size bed. None for the sofa bed or the crib. We were unable to get more for the room because the hotel was sold out. I after the third day of sleeping on a small pillow, and still unable to get any extra pillows I went to a Target and bought new pillows.
reviews.title: Great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was nice, breakfast was crowded because the hotel was sold out. For the price it wasn't too bad. Location is close to the city. Good for a family on a budget like me.
reviews.title: super friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great staff at this hotel and some rooms look to be renovated. The shuttle is convienent and provides good and quick transportation to the hotel, however, it ends at midnight, which is not helpful when flights are delayed (and they are often at SFO).
reviews.title: Good pre-flight option

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Word of advice .. if you have a room that faces 101, you will have noise from the CalTrain and some Union Pacific trains. The rooms face the highway and there is a train station right across the street. No earplugs are provided but should not be horrid as no horns are blown.
reviews.title: First rate staff and facility

reviews.text: Hotel is about 10 minutes away from the airport. Courtesy shuttle runs twice an hour. Check in was fast and courteous. Rooms are older but are well kept. Comfortable bed, flat screen TV and free wifi. Bathroom was also in good condition. There is a mini fridge, coffe maker and microwave in the room. A decent continental breakfast is also served. As for room locations, this hotel is located right next to the main rail line and Caltrain, the commuter rail stops at the station just opposite the hotel, and those that do not stop there blew their horn as they pass. So to get a quiet room, ask for one on the opposite side of the hotel, or in the courtyard area. Not much either in the way of restaurants.
reviews.title: Good for over night airport stop over

reviews.text: I was here on business and needed a shuttle from the airport. The shuttle was very good and efficient, drivers were polite and knowledgable about the area. The hotel needs a little work, to make the rooms current and updated. The bed was comfortable but the couch and the bedspread just gave me the chills in that they appeared to be dirty. From the air conditioning/heater to the outside area surrounded by traffic and trains, this was a very loud place to stay. I thankfully have a bad ear so I was able to tune it out most of the time but I could still hear the noises all night that didn't go away. I felt a bit unsafe as a single woman traveler and asked for a room up front which they were able to accomodate, I was thankful for that. The breakfast was good, although i got there late and they seemed to not restock as the closing time neared. I would not stay here as a couple or family but for buisness it did me just fine.
reviews.title: Loud but comfortable
Convenient to Caltrain
reviews.text: My airline cancelled my flight and stranded me in San Francisco for a day, but they were kind enough to get me a hotel room at the Comfort Inn. It's a little shabby, but I hardly noticed. Breakfast was filling (I had eggs, but there were other things available, too). The best part was the proximity to a Caltrain station. Climb the hill behind the hotel, walk across the overpass, and turn right at the crosswalk/stop light. You'll see a Caltrain station at the bottom of the stairs. Note: I would not want to be in this area alone at night, but it was fine during the day. The station is in zone 1 (same as downtown), so the cost to ride Caltrain all day is just $6. It drops you off at King & 4th where you can grab a bus to Market street or a tram to the Embarcadero. The hotel has a free shuttle to the airport.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The brown coverlets on the beds were questionable, but the bathroom was surprisingly modern and very clean. I'd stay here again.
reviews.title: Clean & Affordable Airport Hotel

reviews.text: We chose to stay here as we often times stay at Comfort Suites. This property doesn't quite measure up to the Comfort Suites standards, but what I would like to point out is that the staff are very polite, helpful, and customer service oriented. We needed a hotel close to SFO that offered a shuttle. This place met our requirements. Because we had an early flight we had to leave before breakfast was ready. The employees offered us donuts and fresh fruit while we waited for the shuttle, even though breakfast wasn't supposed to start for another 30 minutes. Sometimes it's the little things that matter. On to the room. It was clean, the king sized bed was pretty comfy, the flat screen TV was nice, with plenty of satellite channels to choose from. The room was fully outfitted with a mini fridge, microwave, ironing board, iron, hairdryer, etc... If you forgot anything, there was a note letting you know they'd be happy to help, simply give the front desk a call. While I wouldn't rate this property as above average from a facility standpoint, I would give them five stars for customer service. If you're looking for a reasonably priced hotel near SFO this is a good choice!
reviews.title: Great Customer Service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were due to arrive in San Francisco for at 11pm after flying from the UK so were primarily looking for somewhere close to the airport. This hotel fitted the bill, literally a 5 minute drive from the car rental centre. It was the cheapest hotel of our stay and it sort of showed with the fixtures and fittings maybe being a little shabby and dated, but it was clean and tidy with a large, comfortable bed which was welcome after such a long flight. It was a bit on the noisy side and there was a busy freeway bridge almost overhead, and an equally busy railway yard opposite our window with large engines being shunted back and forth all hours of the night. (On the plus side, the noise drowned out the busy San Francisco International Airport just a couple of miles away!). That was the only big negative and obviously out of the hotel's control.
reviews.title: Convenient, Cheap & Cheerful

reviews.text: The complementary breakfast was decent enough (sausages, egg, self service toaster and waffle iron etc.).
reviews.title: Great price for a weekend stay in San Fran!

reviews.text: The staff we met were all as polite, friendly and helpful as any in the more up market hotels we would stay in later in our trip.
reviews.title: Great inexpensive place to stay when in San Fran

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was very close to San Bruno where there is a BART station (a light railway), where you can get a train to San Francisco itself in about 25 minutes. All day parking at the station is there for $2 per day.
reviews.title: Relaxing outdoor spa and breakfast area

reviews.text: Overall, an okay hotel, fine for the price and good for anyone looking for somewhere cheap, near to the airport but with good transport links into San Francisco
reviews.title: Great price, great location!

reviews.text: We stayed at Comfort Inn SF Airport North for a single night. Interior of our room was larger than a typical airport motel. Large enough for a small sofa, coffee table and desk. Nice touches with deep crown moulding, acceptable decor, okay beds, and a 42 inch flat screen. Free wifi is a plus I always think.
reviews.title: Comfortable airport motel but bring your earplugs.

reviews.text: Bathrooms are better than most airport motels with Corian like vanity/sink unit and a granite like shower/tub enclosure instead of those ugly prefab flimsy units.
reviews.title: Served Its Purpose Well

reviews.text: They offer a free breakfast bar till 10am with cook your own waffles, pastries, cereal, fruit, eggs and full size sausages (not that paper thin bacon I run across too often nowadays. Coffee, tea and juices round breakfast out.
reviews.title: worked out very well

reviews.text: They also offer a park n fly program for approximately $130 for a single night you can leave your car up to two weeks. That's a bargain given the airport charges about $18-20 a day to park.
reviews.title: Nice for the Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only irritating issue was the freeway and train noise at night and early morning. Double pane windows was not enough to quiet the noise and the door seemed to let the noise seep through effortlessly. Perhaps a room on the opposite side of the property facing the airport (lol) would be quieter? So a pair of ear plugs, or one if their nice pillows over my ears might have helped.
reviews.title: Good Value close to the Airport but...

reviews.text: I stayed here for only one night of a planned two-night stay, because their internet service was very poor to non-existent. I had called the technical support line twice, at 1:30 AM and 7:30 AM, and they were unable to restore my service.
reviews.title: Convenient location; good price; some disappointments....

reviews.text: The room was comfortable, with a queen bed and a sofa, flat-screen TV, microwave and fridge. I do not like the new, small-sized pillows that Quality Inns have started to use...I find them uncomfortable. Other than that, the bed was OK. The entire feel of the building was a little tired, but potentially could be very nice with a little renovation in paint, small repairs, etc.
reviews.title: Return Trip
Delightful staff,bad fitness room,bad wifi
reviews.text: The breakfast variety was quite good, with eggs and sausage in addition to the usual waffles, fruit, cereals, etc.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was also a nightly parking charge of $6.
reviews.title: very great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Second time to stay here. It's close to the airport, good for early flight times. Room was clean with a huge bathroom and it was quiet enough. Price is better than most. No time for the breakfast and still didn't get to use the outdoor spa so I can't review them.
reviews.title: Convenient location and Friendly staff but watch out for the train side

reviews.text: Our overnight stay here was fine, the room was clean and beds were comfortable. The breakfast selection was good and the overall price for the room with tax was under $100. The only downside was having to pay for parking($6.60), NOT COOL! If you happened to be traveling with two vehicles, there is a 1 vehicle per room limit, otherwise $35 a night for the extra parking fee...ridiculous!
reviews.title: Decent room, good breakfast

reviews.text: Property well maintained and rooms were kept very clean. We had two rooms and the housekeepers forgot to put towels in one the first night. Stayed three nights and found variable pricing (Fri.-Sun. being lower). Facility caters to tour groups and there were two buses full of people each night which made for very crowded conditions in the morning at breakfast.
reviews.title: Airport hotel with connections

reviews.text: Desk personnel were extremely polite, knowledgeable, and efficient.
reviews.title: An airport hotel. Huge. Not bad, not great. Near the CalTrain line!

reviews.text: Daily parking charge. Restaurants about 10-15 minutes away (walking).
reviews.title: Great sleep and good location

reviews.text: Would we rush back to stay here? No. This is a huge facility with many buildings. Well run under the circumstances, but felt like a cattle car a bit. Shuttle worked fine despite some other reviews. Breakfast was amazingly crowded. But average Comfort Inn type. We were able to spend but $3 and easily walk to and catch the CalTrain right nearby (into SF in but 20 minutes). Wifi seemed fine for us. Front desk not impressive, but given the numbers, they have to rush a bit.
reviews.title: Good value, Good breakfast, Terrible wifi

reviews.text: The hotel has cleaned itself up alot since I was there a few years ago but I think they still have a long way to go . Looks old and tired . The staff seemed not into there jobs .
reviews.title: A traveling single guy review

reviews.text: The hot tub was nice . I thought the beds were poor . Old style bed bedding that makes me nervous about the last time it was cleaned .
reviews.title: Comfortable & Affordable

reviews.text: For someone like myself one quick night and not concerned about dark parking lots and weird homeless people its fine
reviews.title: A Wonderful Place to Stay!

reviews.text: I would not stay here with my family due to or being dark and not safe area .
reviews.title: Good value and would return

reviews.text: A short walk away is a Embassy Suites , a Hampton Inn and a Hilton Garden Inn . Even since they are more money if you are traveling alone or with a family avoid this place and look at other options .
reviews.title: Wireless still useless....

aka: Comfort Inn & Suites San Francisco Airport North Hotel South San Francisco
description: Come stay at the Comfort Inn & Suites San Francisco Airport North for your next business trip, family vacation or romantic retreat to South San Francisco.At our hotel near San Francisco Airport, enjoy our peaceful deluxe rooms, an array of modern services and features, friendly hospitality and value-added packages for the ultimate Bay Area escape.
